question.title: ApplicationModuleTest - BeanInstantiationException: No repository found for type
question.body:
I run a Spring Modulith ApplicationModuleTest in an application that has a Spring Data Rest module with CRUD logic, alongside other Spring Data JDBC modules with "real" domain logic.

The CRUD module contains a Tenant entity, and it defines a RepositoryRestConfigurer bean which does some repository configurations:

@Component
public class MyRepositoryRestConfigurer implements RepositoryRestConfigurer {

  @Override
  public void configureRepositoryRestConfiguration(
      RepositoryRestConfiguration config, CorsRegistry cors) {

    config.setRepositoryDetectionStrategy(
        RepositoryDetectionStrategy.RepositoryDetectionStrategies.ANNOTATED);

    config
        .withEntityLookup()
        .forRepository(TenantRepository.class)
        .withIdMapping(Tenant::getDomainKey)
        .withLookup(TenantRepository::findTenantByDomainKey);

    config.exposeIdsFor(Tenant.class);
  }
}

Some of my tests fail with the following exception, although the Modulith application runs just fine:

BeanInstantiationException: Failed to instantiate
  [org.springframework.data.repository.support.RepositoryInvokerFactory]: 
  Factory method 'repositoryInvokerFactory' threw exception with message: No repository found for type

The tests test @BasePathAwareControllers and are annotated as @ApplicationModuleTest. They use @MockitoBean on the repository that cannot be found by the RepositoryInvokerFactory.

The Tenant entity, the controllers under test and the tests are all part of the CRUD module.

How can I run the tests successfully?

answers.body: It turns out that the problem disappears when MyRepositoryRestConfigurer gets placed outside the Spring Data Rest CRUD module, either toplevel in the application package or inside a toplevel config package. Where it cannot go is inside the CRUD module.
